tournament.name: 5ยบ LPL Open - Season V - Liga Paulista

decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using efficient spells and creatures to control the board while dealing direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure. Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serve as powerful threats that can quickly close out games. The deck also includes Predict and Counterbalance for card advantage and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of control and aggression.

This deck revolves around quickly getting Death's Shadow onto the battlefield and leveraging cards like Grief and Reanimate to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes counterspells like Daze and Force of Will for protection, along with card draw/filtering spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain consistency. The mana base is focused on a combination of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure access to the necessary colors. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with combo pieces and then using spells like Reanimate and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Balustrade Spy and Boggart Trawler. By sacrificing creatures and casting spells like Dark Ritual and Culling the Weak, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combo that can either mill the opponent's deck or win the game on the spot. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Unmask helps protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by taxing their resources with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, while also providing a strong aggro game plan with efficient creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude. The deck also utilizes synergy with cards like Stoneforge Mystic to find powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. With Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and powerful lands like Karakas and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent.

The main focus of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mother of Runes and Solitude. The deck also utilizes flicker effects with cards like Flickerwisp and Yorion, Sky Nomad to gain value and create advantage. With a mix of disruptive elements, aggressive creatures, and synergy between cards like Aether Vial and Recruiter of the Guard, the deck aims to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands as resources. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Wasteland and Swords to Plowshares while also building a strong board presence with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck can generate card advantage with Life from the Loam and Exploration, allowing for consistent land drops. By combining both land destruction and land synergy elements, the deck can adapt to different matchups and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, countermagic, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes card draw and manipulation to find the right answers at the right time. Leyline Binding helps to lock down opponent's threats, while Murktide Regent provides a clock to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue opponents and overwhelm them with its powerful cards and efficient control elements.

The deck focuses on using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards from the library, enabling combos with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Dread Return. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo pieces. Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic provide tutoring and card advantage, while Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion option. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combination while disrupting opponent's strategies to achieve victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient Goblin creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Goblin Lackey and Conspicuous Snoop, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and often. Grief and Reanimate provide disruption and powerful recursion options, while cards like Munitions Expert and Sling-Gang Lieutenant offer removal and reach potential. The inclusion of Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker adds a combo element to the deck, allowing for explosive turns. Overall, the deck is aggressive, resilient, and capable of closing out games quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressive creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Elite Spellbinder. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and control the tempo of the game with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Solitude and Kaldra Compleat to further enhance its creatures. It utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to quickly cast its threats and put pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck while also providing utility with cards like Karakas and Cavern of Souls.

The deck focuses on a creature-based strategy, utilizing cards like Knight of the Reliquary, Mother of Runes, and Noble Hierarch to establish early board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. With access to powerful green cards like Once Upon a Time and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can efficiently find and deploy threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Bojuka Bog provide additional utility and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups and situations.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also utilizes the Stoneforge Mystic package to equipment like Batterskull and Kaldra Compleat to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck includes high-impact threats like Murktide Regent while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle and Prismatic Ending. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Grief, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and ensure a smooth execution of the reanimation strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, impactful creatures early in the game and control the board to secure victory.
